text:

text:
Insufficient information for a bug report: you haven't told us your configure line or your APR installation path.  If it's not detected by default then you have to use --with-apr-util.

Please use the user support list for help with build and configuration issues.
creator: nick@webthing.com
petrus@ibm-jti.com
text:
(In reply to comment #1)
> Insufficient information for a bug report: you haven't told us your configure
> line or your APR installation path.  If it's not detected by default then you
> have to use --with-apr-util.
> 
> Please use the user support list for help with build and configuration issues.

i'm sorry i forget to include this :
"./configure --prefix=/usr/local/apache --with-apr=/usr/local/apr-httpd/ --with-apr-util=/usr/local/apr-util-httpd/"

creator: noedadon85@gmail.com
text:
I suggest to the apache team that BEFORE making something public you have to test it. The installation process is full of bugs and this one : 

configure: error: APR version 1.3.0 or later is required

Is still not resolved.
Still no details.  Apache builds on Linux for most people.
creator: covener@gmail.com

text:
I see the same issue here on my build.  apr-1.5.1 and apr-utils-1.5.4 are installed. But nevertheless the configure script can't find it and abort with 

checking for APR version 1.3.0 or later... no
configure: error: APR version 1.3.0 or later is required
 

My assumption is that something is not included the right way or some path is wrong
creator: oliver.graute@neuhaus.de

text:
the dirty workaround for me was the following:


cd /usr/include
sudo ln -sf apr-1.0/ apr-1

after that it found the right apr version
creator: oliver.graute@neuhaus.de
